Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to amending the New York City Pro-Voter Law by mandating annual training for agencies, verbal assistance for the public and agency transmission of registration forms.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Amending the NYC Pro-Voter Law by mandating annual training for agencies, verbal assistance for the public and agency transmission of registration forms.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the composition of the Voter Assistance Commission.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Composition of the Voter Assistance Commission.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the board of elections notifying city residents who voted by affidavit or paper ballot as to whether or not their vote was tallied, and if not, provide a reason.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Board of elections notifying city residents who voted by affidavit or paper ballot as to whether or not their vote was tallied.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the State Election Law to extend the right to vote to individuals who are currently serving parole.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Amend the State Election Law, extend the right to vote to individuals who are currently serving parole.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York State Legislature to amend the election law in relation to adding the term “domestic partner” to the list of family members one may accompany outside of the election district and be eligible to receive an absentee ballot.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: NYS Legislature to amend the election law in relation to adding the term "domestic partner" to the list of family members.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the United States Congress to pass the Count Every Vote Act of 2005, introduced in the Senate by Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton and in the House by Representative Stephanie Tubbs Jones, a comprehensive package of pro-democracy, pro-voter legislation that contains the Civic Participation Act of 2005, a measure to restore voting rights in Federal elections to ex-offenders who have completed their sentences.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass the Count Every Vote Act of 2005.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to amending the New York City Pro-Voter Law by mandating annual training for agencies, verbal assistance for the public and agency transmission of registration forms.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
Items.MatterName: Amending the NYC Pro-Voter Law by mandating annual training for agencies, verbal assistance for the public and agency transmission of registration forms.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating civil penalties and a private right of action for false or fraudulent claims.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Creating civil penalties and a private right of action for false or fraudulent claims.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating civil penalties and a private right of action for false or fraudulent claims.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Creating civil penalties and a private right of action for false or fraudulent claims.
